newsitem.title: USA: Customedix says its court settlement stands.
newsitem.headline: Customedix says its court settlement stands.

text.p: Customedix Corp said on Friday the appeal period on a court decision had expired, clearing the way for a private buyout of the company.

A Delaware Chancery Court had approved an out-of-court settlement of a shareholder law suit 30 days ago, the company said in a statement. Shareholders had tried to stop Customedix chairman and chief executive Gordon Cohen and a parternership made up of Cohen family trusts from buying the company.
Under the buyout terms, all Customedix shareholders, apart from Cohen and the partnership, would get $2.375 for each Customedix share.
